revised_title: Statistical Analysis of a Random Moving Surface and its Two-Dimensional Spectrum
tldr: The authors study the statistical properties of a random, moving Gaussian surface in relation to its two-dimensional spectrum. They derive various statistical properties, such as the probability distribution of surface elevation, average number of zero-crossings, and average length of contours. These findings are relevant to understanding waves in the open ocean and may also apply to other geophysical phenomena.
